meanings.sent1: The judge bails the suspect out of jail.
meanings.sent2: The kind officer bails out the innocent man.
meanings.sent3: The detective bails the suspect out, only to find new evidence.
meanings.sent4: Freedom bails out the accused from the chains of confinement.
meanings.sent5: The key witness bails the defendant out with their testimony.

meanings.definition: A bar used to support something
meanings.sent1: The shelf needed an extra set of bails for stability.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge had strong bails to hold it up.
meanings.sent3: The wobbly table was fixed with sturdy bails underneath.
meanings.sent4: The bails of the gate creaked in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The construction worker secured the beam with metal bails.

meanings.definition: To abandon a task or responsibility
meanings.sent1: He bails on his friends when they need him most.
meanings.sent2: She always bails on her chores to go play outside.
meanings.sent3: The cat bails on catching the mouse and takes a nap instead.
meanings.sent4: The student bails on studying and watches TV all night.
meanings.sent5: The employee bails on the project, leaving others to pick up the slack.
